condition.description:
Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) happens when a woman's ovaries or adrenal glands produce more male hormones than normal. One result is that cysts (fluid-filled sacs) develop on the ovaries. Women who are obese are more likely to have polycystic ovary syndrome.

Symptoms of PCOS include:

  • Infertility
  • Pelvic pain
  • Excess hair growth on the face, chest, stomach, thumbs, or toes
  • Baldness or thinning hair
  • Acne, oily skin, or dandruff
  • Patches of thickened dark brown or black skin

Women with PCOS are at higher risk of diabetes, metabolic syndrome, heart disease, and high blood pressure. Medicines can help control the symptoms. Birth control pills help women have normal periods, reduce male hormone levels, and clear acne. Other medicines can reduce hair growth and control blood pressure and cholesterol. There is no cure.

NIH: National Institute of Child Health and Human Development
condition.name: Polycystic ovarian syndrome

carousel_items: Takes several weeks to see full effect on blood sugar control.
Can cause weight gain, headache, and fluid retention.
Tell your doctor about any mental confusion, persistent abdominal pain, dark urine, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising.
Not recommended for patients with certain heart problems.

basics.benefits_moa: Actos is an anti-diabetic drug. It improves your body's ability to use insulin to lower your blood sugar.
basics.bottom_line: Actos is a last-choice blood sugar-lowering medicine since it's only moderately effective but has a lot of undesirable side effects.
downsides: May take several weeks to lower blood sugar.
You have to check your blood sugar regularly with this medicine.
Has more side effects than similar medicines, so it's usually not the first choice for new Type 2 diabetes patients.
More likely to cause weight gain (2 to 6 pounds or more) compared to other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

Up to 1 in 10 people might get fluid retention (edema), ranging from mild ankle swelling to severe swelling in the lungs that makes it hard to breathe. People with severe congestive heart failure shouldn't use Actos.
Raises the risk of bone fractures, especially for people who already have a risk for fractures.
Slightly raises the risk of bladder cancer.

downsides_processed.orig: May take several weeks to lower blood sugar.
You have to check your blood sugar regularly with this medicine.
Has more side effects than similar medicines, so it's usually not the first choice for new Type 2 diabetes patients.
More likely to cause weight gain (2 to 6 pounds or more) compared to other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

Up to 1 in 10 people might get fluid retention (edema), ranging from mild ankle swelling to severe swelling in the lungs that makes it hard to breathe. People with severe congestive heart failure shouldn't use Actos.
Raises the risk of bone fractures, especially for people who already have a risk for fractures.
Slightly raises the risk of bladder cancer.

upsides: Lowers A1c levels by around 1%. (Hemoglobin A1c measures your average blood sugar over time.)
Prevents the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers A1c levels by around 1%. (Hemoglobin A1c measures your average blood sugar over time.)
Prevents the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.

userStories.tip: Look out for overeating - Actos users tend to gain weight if they are not careful. Take it every evening before bedtime.
I take it just before bedtime for most effective results

drugs.name: Actos

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes several weeks to see full effect on blood sugar control.
Can cause weight gain, headache, and fluid retention.
Tell your doctor about any mental confusion, persistent abdominal pain, dark urine, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising.
Not recommended for patients with certain heart problems.

risks_warnings.title: Problematic fluid build up from poor heart function (Congestive heart failure)
risks_warnings.description: Actos can cause too much fluid buildup in your body, which can  cause or worsen congestive heart failure. Your doctor should follow your blood tests and weight closely when you start Actos or increase your dose. People with heart failure classification NYHA Class III/IV shouldn't use Actos.

description_processed.orig: Actos can cause too much fluid buildup in your body, which can  cause or worsen congestive heart failure. Your doctor should follow your blood tests and weight closely when you start Actos or increase your dose. People with heart failure classification NYHA Class III/IV shouldn't use Actos.

risks_warnings.title: Fluid retention (Edema)
risks_warnings.description: Actos may increase fluid buildup in your body, called edema. The risk increases with a higher dose. Tell your doctor about any unexpected weight gain, swelling of extremities, or trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Actos may increase fluid buildup in your body, called edema. The risk increases with a higher dose. Tell your doctor about any unexpected weight gain, swelling of extremities, or trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There is not enough information that Actos damages the liver. Baseline liver tests are recommended before starting Actos. Tell your doctor about any stomach pain that don't go away, dark urine, or yellowing of eyes/skin.

description_processed.orig: There is not enough information that Actos damages the liver. Baseline liver tests are recommended before starting Actos. Tell your doctor about any stomach pain that don't go away, dark urine, or yellowing of eyes/skin.

risks_warnings.title: Bladder cancer
risks_warnings.description: There is a small chance that Actos can cause bladder cancer. Actos is not recommended for people who have current bladder cancer. Actos should be used carefully with close monitoring in patients with a history of bladder cancer.

description_processed.orig: There is a small chance that Actos can cause bladder cancer. Actos is not recommended for people who have current bladder cancer. Actos should be used carefully with close monitoring in patients with a history of bladder cancer.

risks_warnings.title: Bone fracture
risks_warnings.description: Research studies with Actos showed an increase in broken bones in women but not men. Talk to your doctor to find out ways to maintain good bone health when taking Actos.

description_processed.orig: Research studies with Actos showed an increase in broken bones in women but not men. Talk to your doctor to find out ways to maintain good bone health when taking Actos.

carousel_items: Can make you dizzy or cause trouble concentrating, so be careful using it until you know how the medicine affects you.
Don't use supplements or salt substitutes that are high in potassium.
You can have breast pain/swelling, irregular periods (women), or trouble with sexual performance.
Tell your doctor about any muscle weakness, skin changes, red or black tarry stool.
Can take 2 to 3 days to see full diuretic effects and 2 to 3 weeks to see blood pressure lowering effects.

basics.benefits_moa: Spironolactone is a potassium-sparing diuretic that blocks aldosterone (a hormone) and helps the kidney get rid of excess fluids in your body.
basics.bottom_line: Spironolactone is helpful when added to another diuretic to get rid of excess fluid in your body. Doesn't work well on its own.
downsides: Not very good at getting rid of excess fluids on its own. Should be used with another drug to help get rid of excess fluids.
Has many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs to have blood tests done to monitor electrolyte levels and kidney function.

downsides_processed.orig: Not very good at getting rid of excess fluids on its own. Should be used with another drug to help get rid of excess fluids.
Has many possible side effects, especially when higher doses are used.
Can increase the risk of tumor growth.
Needs to have blood tests done to monitor electrolyte levels and kidney function.

upsides: Has a low risk of causing muscle problems due to low potassium levels in your blood.
More useful when taken with another diuretic that'll also help your body get rid of extra fluids.
Reduces the risk of death in people with heart failure.

upsides_processed.orig: Has a low risk of causing muscle problems due to low potassium levels in your blood.
More useful when taken with another diuretic that'll also help your body get rid of extra fluids.
Reduces the risk of death in people with heart failure.

drugs.one_liner: Removes extra water from your body.

userStories.tip: I took Lasix for the past few months and it took the major lower extremities swelling down in the ER. Then was switched to this drug (Spironolactone) and swelling is back, 9 lbs put on in 24 hours! Very upsetting as it is the weekend.
Caused enlarged breasts, and sore nipples, as well as high glucose levels. scary stuff
I wish I had started at a higher dose from the start. 25mg did nothing, now months later, I'm on 100mg and it's much more effective.
might make you feel tired like beta blockers.

drugs.name: Aldactone

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can make you dizzy or cause trouble concentrating, so be careful using it until you know how the medicine affects you.
Don't use supplements or salt substitutes that are high in potassium.
You can have breast pain/swelling, irregular periods (women), or trouble with sexual performance.
Tell your doctor about any muscle weakness, skin changes, red or black tarry stool.
Can take 2 to 3 days to see full diuretic effects and 2 to 3 weeks to see blood pressure lowering effects.

risks_warnings.title: Tumor development
risks_warnings.description: Use of Spironolactone in rats showed higher risk of tumor growth, so it should only be used for FDA-approved indications.

description_processed.orig: Use of Spironolactone in rats showed higher risk of tumor growth, so it should only be used for FDA-approved indications.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Spironolactone lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Spironolactone lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems from high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Spironolactone can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your potassium and kidney function.

description_processed.orig: Spironolactone can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine blood tests are needed to monitor your potassium and kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Breast pain or swelling
risks_warnings.description: Spironolactone can cause breast pain or swelling in both men and women. It is generally reversible after stopping the medicine, but rarely can be irreversible.

description_processed.orig: Spironolactone can cause breast pain or swelling in both men and women. It is generally reversible after stopping the medicine, but rarely can be irreversible.

carousel_items: Can cause upset stomach with nausea and especially diarrhea in the first couple of weeks.
Always take it with food or switch to the extended release version to avoid upset stomach.
Tell your doctor about any deep or rapid breathing, or persistent nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain.

clock.tip: Works faster if taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Metformin is an anti-diabetic drug. It lowers sugar production in your body, decreases sugar absorption in your intestines, and makes your body more sensitive to insulin.
basics.bottom_line: Metformin is a very effective medicine to lower blood sugar and the risk of complications and death from diabetes, but it's likely to cause diarrhea for the first few weeks.
downsides: Most people will have nausea, indigestion, or diarrhea in the first few weeks. You can minimize this if you take it on a full stomach.
People with poor kidney function can't use it.
Only works if your body can still make your own insulin, a hormone that tells your body what to do with sugar, protein, and fat.

downsides_processed.orig: Most people will have nausea, indigestion, or diarrhea in the first few weeks. You can minimize this if you take it on a full stomach.
People with poor kidney function can't use it.
Only works if your body can still make your own insulin, a hormone that tells your body what to do with sugar, protein, and fat.

upsides: A common first treatment for people with newly-diagnosed Type 2 diabetes.
The only oral diabetes medicine that lowers complications and deaths from conditions related to diabetes.
Lowers A1c levels by 1-2%. (Hemoglobin A1c measures your average blood sugar over time.)
Prevents the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Also lowers certain lipid (fat and cholesterol) levels.
Unlike some diabetes medicines, doesn't cause weight gain or low blood sugar.
You don't have to check your blood sugar every day with this medicine.
One of the least expensive diabetes medicines.

Also lowers certain lipid (fat and cholesterol) levels.
Unlike some diabetes medicines, doesn't cause weight gain or low blood sugar.
You don't have to check your blood sugar every day with this medicine.
One of the least expensive diabetes medicines.

userStories.tip: s/e of flatulence and stool changes a firstt

With its 900mg twice a day dosage in my case you'd be definitely prone to side effects. Have found diet control plus exercise to be a much better option. I now take one dosage every three days just as a precautionary measure.

I think it has helped but I also took lots of hormones at the same time so it is hard to pin down exactly what helped my symptoms. Be very careful with alcohol...I had a couple of bad experiences even after just 2 glasses of wine.
After taking it for three weeks and feeling very good, I developed a massive rash that itched so badly I was ready to claw my skin off. Too bad.  It was really working for me.
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: If you are having GI issues while taking it, try drinking more water with the dosage.
If prescribed by your doctor to take a larger dose, take it after your evening meal. Rather than in the morning. I find that this is less likely to cause stomach issues.
I take it morning and night with meals, it's like taking my vitamins. Not hard at all. I test my blood sugar 6 times a day or more. Before/after every meal. Only side effect I have had is gas.
very cheap, effective, no side effects after first 1-2 weeks

Start dose low and escalate slowly. Expect mild nausea at start and with dose increases. It will go away, so stick with it. I feel fine now. I am convinced that this medicine also helped me lose weight too, thus improving my glucose #s.
userStories.identifier: Physician with new diagnosis of diabetes

drugs.name: Metformin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause upset stomach with nausea and especially diarrhea in the first couple of weeks.
Always take it with food or switch to the extended release version to avoid upset stomach.
Tell your doctor about any deep or rapid breathing, or persistent nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain.

risks_warnings.title: Death from lactic acid build up (Lactic acidosis)
risks_warnings.description: Metformin can cause this rare but life-threatening condition. Symptoms include deep and rapid breathing, nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain. This is a medical emergency and you should get help right away. Baseline blood work for kidney and liver function are helpful to see if you can use Metformin. It may not be a good choice for people with kidney problems. Metformin should be stopped 48 hours before and/or after surgery or any imaging procedure needing contrast dye.

description_processed.orig: Metformin can cause this rare but life-threatening condition. Symptoms include deep and rapid breathing, nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain. This is a medical emergency and you should get help right away. Baseline blood work for kidney and liver function are helpful to see if you can use Metformin. It may not be a good choice for people with kidney problems. Metformin should be stopped 48 hours before and/or after surgery or any imaging procedure needing contrast dye.

risks_warnings.title: Low red blood cell count (Megaloblastic anemia )
risks_warnings.description: Metformin can cause a rare type of anemia with large, immature red blood cells but not enough healthy ones. Let your doctor know about any persistent low energy, muscle weakness, low appetite, tingling or numbness on hands/feet. A blood test can help determine if you have anemia and if Metformin is the reason.
